column4: anyone know how to make / use modelines ? for some reason any Linux installations I try are unable to give me the full resolution (1280 x 1024) like my hardware was intended to (and which works in winXP no probs).
I have a nvidia 8800 gt, and a 17 " screen with max resolution 1280 x 1024, but I don't know how to generate a modeline for this hardware combination
can you pastebin the file /var/log/Xorg.0.log ?
http://pastebin.ca/1425727
looking...
what kind of monitor are you using?
do you know the max vertical and horizontal frequencies
its an acer al1706, max res 1280 x 1024, but not sure how to get the frequencies, I checked the manual and its not there..
Horiz Freq: 48 khz, Vertical: 60hz
ah.. you found it.. ok.. hang on
haven't forgot you..still working on it =)
you could try this modeline.. not sure if it will work though "Modeline "1280x1024@60" 114.98 1280 1312 1744 1776 1024 1045 1055 1076"
you could also try one of the standard ones from this site http://linux.50webs.org/resources/modelines.htm
did you ever figure out that modeline stuff ?
oh.. you didn't see my message? hang on.. let me repeat them
you could try this modeline.. not sure if it will work though "Modeline "1280x1024@60" 114.98 1280 1312 1744 1776 1024 1045 1055 1076"
sorry yeah I had to go outside for a few minutes, so the message is long gon
you could also try one of the standard ones from this site http://linux.50webs.org/resources/modelines.htm
do I use xrandr for this, or put in my xorg.conf ?
I would put it in the xorg.conf
does the modeline go under "monitor" or "screen" ?
here are some examples.. http://www.viajes-abaco.com/m400a/xorg_conf.htm
there is horizsync and vertrefresh
I haven't done this in at least 2 years.. you could check "man xorg.conf" for some up to date info
